summary.p: 42 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 2; Qurʾānic Text: Q 16:96-17,73/74, Q 23:36-31:14, Q 55:22-61:14; 21 lines per page; Dimensions: 415 x 425-430mm; Script style: kūfī C I.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 2
42 fol. 425/430×415 mm (1.024/1.036). Support: parchment, thick and semitransparent, yellowish on the hair side, grayish on the flesh side. Writing material: brown ink, of different density.
Collation: it is problematic to determine the exact number and composition of quires. Presumably there are six quires, of different completeness.
I: H1F - F2H / H3F F4H H5F, fol. 1 and 4, 2–3 are bifolia, f. 5 is now a singleton.
II: H6F F7H H8F F9H / H10F F11H H12F F13H H14F, all are bifolia except fol. 14 that has lost its counter-folio.
III: F15H H16F F17H H18F F19H / H20F F21H H22F F23H H24F, all are bifolia, fol. 15 and 24 detached from each other.
IV: F25H / H26F F27H H28F, fol. 25 and 26 are now singletons, fol. 27–28 is a bifolium.
V: H29F F30H / H31F F32H F33H, two bifolia and fol. 33 that is cut off along the fold.

VI: H34F F35H H36F S? F37H / H38F S? F39H H40F F41H H42F, three bifolia (fol. 34 and 41 are cut off from each other, fol. 35 and 40, fol. 37–38), fol. 36 and 39 are singletons with stubs, glued to each other, fol. 41 is now single.
(проверить по рукописи – ОЯ)
Text layout: 350×305/310 mm (1.1666?), 21 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: C I. Diacritics: diagonal dashes, in the same ink as the main text; no vocalization marks.

Verse markers: individual verses – three diagonal dashes (type 1.1.1) , in the same ink as the main text; groups of 10 verses – red circle with a black point in the center (type 1.A.I); groups of 100(?) verses – red circle (same as previous 10-verse mark) with petals and rays in brownish ink (see ff. 7v, 17r).
Surah titles were inscribed in the blank lines at a later time in black ink, naskhi script:
Surah 17 – lower part of the folio with the heading is lost (fol. 2r);
Surah 24 – سورة النور سبعون واربع اية (fol. 8r);
Surah 25 – سورة الفرقان سبعون وسبع اية (fol. 12r);
Surah 26 – سورة الشعرا مئتان وعشرون وسبع ايات (fol. 15r);
Surah 27 – سورة النمل تسعون وثلث اية (fol. 19r);
Surah 28 – سورة القصص ثمانون وثمان اية (fol. 23r);
Surah 29 –سورة العنكبوت ستون وتسع اية (fol. 27v);
Surah 30 – سورة الروم ستون اية (fol. 31v);
Surah 31 –سورة لقمن ثلثون واربع اية (fol. 33r);
Surah 55 – سورة الواقعة تسعون وست اية (fol. 34v);
Surah 57 – سورة الحديد عشرون وتسع اية (fol. 36r);
Surah 58 –سورة المجادلة عشرون وايتان (fol. 38r);
Surah 59 – سورة الحج عشرون واربع اية (fol. 39v);
Surah 60 – سورة الممتحنة ثلث وعشرة اية (fol. 41r);
Surah 61– سورة الصف اربع عشرة اية (fol. 42r).
Inscriptions: a waqf mark (وقف) in naskhi script, in black ink on the outer margin of fol. 13r; surah and verse numbers in pencil on some pages.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold of the 1st, 2nd, 3d, 4th and 6th quire. On the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).

Defects: stains, traces of moisture at the edges of folios; lower margins of fol. 1–5, 33 are lost (with the loss of text); a hole at the outer lower corners of fol. 26–32; sporadic parchment destruction under ink; on the flesh sides ink has peeled off in some places.

Old conservation: margins of some folios and deteriorated fragments of parchment are cut off; the fold of fol. 14 is strengthened with a strip of paper; parts of fol. 25, 26, 35 and 40 are restored with parchment.
Old accession numbers: A. 3 (according to Langlois’ inventory)
Contents:
Fol. 1r-2r. Surah 16, verses 98(96) – 128(128)*. Incipit: [عند الله باقٍ] ولنحزِيَنَّ.
Fol. 2r-5v. Surah 17, verses 1(1) – 75(73). Explicit: […] أَعْمَى وَأَضَلُّ (further text lost with the torn-off part of the folio).
Fol. 6r-8r. Surah 23, verses 38(36) – 118 (118)*. Incipit: [تُراباً وعِظاماً] أنّكم مُخرَجون.
Fol. 8r-12r. Surah 24.
Fol. 12r-15r. Surah 25.
Fol. 15r-19r. Surah 26.
Fol. 19r-23r. Surah 27.
Fol. 23r-27v. Surah 28.
Fol. 27v-30v. Surah 29.
Fol. 30v-33r. Surah 30.
Fol. 33r-33v. Surah. 31, verses 1(1) – 13(14). Explicit: وهناً على وهنٍ (further text lost with the torn-off part of the folio).
Fol. 34r-34v. Surah 55, verses 22(22) – 78(78)*. Incipit: [اللؤلؤ] والمرجان.
Fol. 34v-36r. Surah 56.
Fol. 36r-38r. Surah 57.
Fol. 38r-39v. Surah 58.
Fol. 39v-41r. Surah 59.
Fol. 41r-42r. Surah 60.
Fol. 42r-42v. Surah 61, verses 1(1) – 14(14). Explicit: أَنصَارَ اللَّهِ كَمَا [قال عيسى]."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
